'''Janine Patricia "Tricia" Gerona Robredo''' (born July 18, 1994) is a Filipino physician and former courtside reporter in [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP]] games for [[NU Bulldogs, Lady Bulldogs, Bullpups and Lady Bullpups|National University Bulldogs]].

== Profile ==
While studying at [[National University (Philippines)|National University]] (NU), Tricia Robredo joined the coverage team of [[ABS-CBN Sports]] that covers the [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP]] in 2013 as a courtside reporter.<ref>{{cite news |last1=de Vera |first1=Ruel |date=April 24, 2016 |title=Aika Robredo–Leni's secret campaign weapon |url=http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/227424/aika-robredo-lenis-secret-campaign-weapon |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160429012347/http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/227424/aika-robredo-lenis-secret-campaign-weapon |archive-date=April 29, 2016 |access-date=May 28, 2016 |newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer.net]]}}</ref> She said that her sideline was for her late father, former [[Secretary of the Interior and Local Government|DILG Secretary]] [[Jesse Robredo]] who died in a [[2012 Philippines Piper Seneca crash|plane crash]] who is an avid fan of basketball. Then-Congresswoman [[Leni Robredo]] said that Tricia is the most affected of his death.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bacani |first=Louis |date=August 16, 2013 |title=Tricia Robredo's courtside reporting stint is for her dad |url=https://www.philstar.com/sports/2013/08/16/1097911/tricia-robredos-courtside-reporting-stint-her-dad?nomobile=1 |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> She stayed as a courtside reporter until 2014,<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Lozada |first=Mei-Lin |date=July 14, 2014 |title=National softball player turned beauty queen, MYX VJ, radio jock make up 2014 batch of UAAP courtside reporters |url=https://www.spin.ph/softball/beauty-queen-mtv-vj-radio-jock-make-up-2014-batch-of-uaap-courtside-reporters |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Spin.ph |language=en}}</ref> when the [[NU Bulldogs basketball|basketball team]] [[UAAP Season 77 basketball tournaments|won the championship]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=Lozada |first=Mei-Lin |date=October 6, 2014 |title=Courtside reporter Tricia Robredo, true-blue Atenean, happy to be part of a 'family' with NU Bulldogs |url=https://www.spin.ph/basketball/uaap-men/atenean-tricia-robredo-happy-to-see-her-team-national-u-in-the-finals?ref=article_tag |work=SPIN.ph}}</ref> She was almost not returning due to her medical school pursuit in Ateneo, but still managed to be flexible at reporting with the Bulldogs.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Leongson |first=Randolph B. |date=July 17, 2020 |title=Tricia Robredo won't ever forget courtside view to NU Bulldogs' 2014 dream run |url=https://www.spin.ph/basketball/uaap-men/nu-courtside-reporter-tricia-robredo-almost-missed-out-on-bulldogs-2014-title-run-a2437-20200717?ref=article_tag |work=SPIN.ph}}</ref> 

Tricia Robredo later studied at [[Ateneo de Manila University|Ateneo de Manila's]] [https://www.asmph.ateneo.edu/home School of Medicine and Public Health] from 2014.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite news |last=Basco |first=Karl Cedrick |date=December 6, 2018 |title=Cheering opposing teams, VP Leni and daughters soaked in UAAP finals fever |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/sports/12/06/18/cheering-opposing-teams-vp-leni-and-daughters-soaked-in-uaap-finals-fever |work=[[ABS-CBN News]]}}</ref> She got her medical license in 2020.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ilaya |first=Dara |date=April 1, 2022 |title=Where R They Now? 10 courtside reporters from the UAAP |url=https://www.spin.ph/life/people/where-r-they-now-10-former-courtside-reporters-src-preview-a5090-20220401?ref=article_tag |work=SPIN.ph}}</ref> 

In [[2022 Philippine presidential election|2022]], while [[Leni Robredo 2022 presidential campaign|campaigning for her mother]], she led an event called ‘''Angatleta sa Araneta''’<ref>{{Cite web |last=dioquino |first=delfin |date=2022-05-03 |title=IN PHOTOS: Athletes show force for Leni-Kiko in 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event |url=https://www.rappler.com/sports/photos-athletes-show-force-leni-robredo-kiko-pangilinan-angatleta-sa-araneta-may-3-2022/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref> which attended by athletes, especially from former UAAP volleyball players who support for her mother's campaign.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Satumbaga-Villar |first=Kristel |date=May 3, 2022 |title=Volleyball stars headline 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event for Leni Robredo |url=https://mb.com.ph/2022/05/02/volleyball-stars-headline-angatleta-sa-araneta-event-for-leni-robredo/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Manila Bulletin |language=en}}</ref> 

Also, in the middle of campaign, same of what happened to her oldest sister and she did, she asked the [[National Bureau of Investigation (Philippines)|National Bureau of Investigation]] to conduct a probe against those who spread fake lewd photos.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cepeda |first=Mara |date=2022-04-26 |title=Like sister Aika, Tricia Robredo seeks NBI probe into fake sex video scandal |url=https://www.rappler.com/philippines/elections/tricia-robredo-seeks-nbi-probe-fake-sex-video-scandal/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Personal life ==
She is the second daughter of former [[Naga, Camarines Sur|Naga]] Mayor [[Jesse Robredo]] and former Vice President [[Leni Robredo]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name="Inquirer">{{cite news |date=April 10, 2016 |title=Vote PH 2016: Leni Robredo |url=http://www.inquirer.net/elections2016/leni-robredo |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405092120/http://www.inquirer.net/elections2016/leni-robredo |archive-date=April 5, 2016 |access-date=April 12, 2016 |newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer.net]]}}</ref><ref name="ABSCBNCOMwhirlwindromance">{{Cite news |last=Punzalan |first=Jamaine |date=October 9, 2015 |title=Leni Robredo relives 'whirlwind' romance with Jesse |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/10/09/15/leni-robredo-relives-whirlwind-romance-jesse |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160111120150/http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/10/09/15/leni-robredo-relives-whirlwind-romance-jesse |archive-date=January 11, 2016 |work=ABS-CBN News}}</ref>

In [[2022 Philippine presidential election|2022]], while [[Leni Robredo 2022 presidential campaign|campaigning for her mother]], she led an event called ‘Angatleta sa Araneta’<ref>{{Cite web |last=dioquino |first=delfin |date=2022-05-03 |title=IN PHOTOS: Athletes show force for Leni-Kiko in 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event |url=https://www.rappler.com/sports/photos-athletes-show-force-leni-robredo-kiko-pangilinan-angatleta-sa-araneta-may-3-2022/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref> which attended by athletes, especially from former UAAP volleyball players who support for her mother's campaign.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Satumbaga-Villar |first=Kristel |date=May 3, 2022 |title=Volleyball stars headline 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event for Leni Robredo |url=https://mb.com.ph/2022/05/02/volleyball-stars-headline-angatleta-sa-araneta-event-for-leni-robredo/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Manila Bulletin |language=en}}</ref>

'''Janine Patricia "Tricia" Gerona Robredo''' (born July 18, 1994) is a Filipino physician and former courtside reporter in [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP]] games for [[NU Bulldogs, Lady Bulldogs, Bullpups and Lady Bullpups|National University Bulldogs]].

== Profile ==
While studying at [[National University (Philippines)|National University]] (NU), Tricia Robredo joined the coverage team of [[ABS-CBN Sports]] that covers the [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP]] in 2013 as a courtside reporter.<ref>{{cite news |last1=de Vera |first1=Ruel |date=April 24, 2016 |title=Aika Robredo–Leni's secret campaign weapon |url=http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/227424/aika-robredo-lenis-secret-campaign-weapon |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160429012347/http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/227424/aika-robredo-lenis-secret-campaign-weapon |archive-date=April 29, 2016 |access-date=May 28, 2016 |newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer.net]]}}</ref> She said that her sideline was for her late father, former [[Secretary of the Interior and Local Government|DILG Secretary]] [[Jesse Robredo]] who died in a [[2012 Philippines Piper Seneca crash|plane crash]] who is an avid fan of basketball. Then-Congresswoman [[Leni Robredo]] said that Tricia is the most affected of his death.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bacani |first=Louis |date=August 16, 2013 |title=Tricia Robredo's courtside reporting stint is for her dad |url=https://www.philstar.com/sports/2013/08/16/1097911/tricia-robredos-courtside-reporting-stint-her-dad?nomobile=1 |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> She stayed as a courtside reporter until 2014,<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Lozada |first=Mei-Lin |date=July 14, 2014 |title=National softball player turned beauty queen, MYX VJ, radio jock make up 2014 batch of UAAP courtside reporters |url=https://www.spin.ph/softball/beauty-queen-mtv-vj-radio-jock-make-up-2014-batch-of-uaap-courtside-reporters |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Spin.ph |language=en}}</ref> when the [[NU Bulldogs basketball|basketball team]] [[UAAP Season 77 basketball tournaments|won the championship]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=Lozada |first=Mei-Lin |date=October 6, 2014 |title=Courtside reporter Tricia Robredo, true-blue Atenean, happy to be part of a 'family' with NU Bulldogs |url=https://www.spin.ph/basketball/uaap-men/atenean-tricia-robredo-happy-to-see-her-team-national-u-in-the-finals?ref=article_tag |work=SPIN.ph}}</ref> She was almost not returning due to her medical school pursuit in Ateneo, but still managed to be flexible at reporting with the Bulldogs.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Leongson |first=Randolph B. |date=July 17, 2020 |title=Tricia Robredo won't ever forget courtside view to NU Bulldogs' 2014 dream run |url=https://www.spin.ph/basketball/uaap-men/nu-courtside-reporter-tricia-robredo-almost-missed-out-on-bulldogs-2014-title-run-a2437-20200717?ref=article_tag |work=SPIN.ph}}</ref> 

Tricia Robredo later studied at [[Ateneo de Manila University|Ateneo de Manila's]] [https://www.asmph.ateneo.edu/home School of Medicine and Public Health] from 2014.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite news |last=Basco |first=Karl Cedrick |date=December 6, 2018 |title=Cheering opposing teams, VP Leni and daughters soaked in UAAP finals fever |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/sports/12/06/18/cheering-opposing-teams-vp-leni-and-daughters-soaked-in-uaap-finals-fever |work=[[ABS-CBN News]]}}</ref> She got her medical license in 2020.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ilaya |first=Dara |date=April 1, 2022 |title=Where R They Now? 10 courtside reporters from the UAAP |url=https://www.spin.ph/life/people/where-r-they-now-10-former-courtside-reporters-src-preview-a5090-20220401?ref=article_tag |work=SPIN.ph}}</ref> 

In [[2022 Philippine presidential election|2022]], while [[Leni Robredo 2022 presidential campaign|campaigning for her mother]], she led an event called ‘''Angatleta sa Araneta''’<ref>{{Cite web |last=dioquino |first=delfin |date=2022-05-03 |title=IN PHOTOS: Athletes show force for Leni-Kiko in 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event |url=https://www.rappler.com/sports/photos-athletes-show-force-leni-robredo-kiko-pangilinan-angatleta-sa-araneta-may-3-2022/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref> which attended by athletes, especially from former UAAP volleyball players who support for her mother's campaign.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Satumbaga-Villar |first=Kristel |date=May 3, 2022 |title=Volleyball stars headline 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event for Leni Robredo |url=https://mb.com.ph/2022/05/02/volleyball-stars-headline-angatleta-sa-araneta-event-for-leni-robredo/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Manila Bulletin |language=en}}</ref> 

Also, in the middle of campaign, same of what happened to her oldest sister and she did, she asked the [[National Bureau of Investigation (Philippines)|National Bureau of Investigation]] to conduct a probe against those who spread fake lewd photos.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cepeda |first=Mara |date=2022-04-26 |title=Like sister Aika, Tricia Robredo seeks NBI probe into fake sex video scandal |url=https://www.rappler.com/philippines/elections/tricia-robredo-seeks-nbi-probe-fake-sex-video-scandal/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Personal life ==
She is the second daughter of former [[Naga, Camarines Sur|Naga]] Mayor [[Jesse Robredo]] and former Vice President [[Leni Robredo]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name="Inquirer">{{cite news |date=April 10, 2016 |title=Vote PH 2016: Leni Robredo |url=http://www.inquirer.net/elections2016/leni-robredo |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405092120/http://www.inquirer.net/elections2016/leni-robredo |archive-date=April 5, 2016 |access-date=April 12, 2016 |newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer.net]]}}</ref><ref name="ABSCBNCOMwhirlwindromance">{{Cite news |last=Punzalan |first=Jamaine |date=October 9, 2015 |title=Leni Robredo relives 'whirlwind' romance with Jesse |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/10/09/15/leni-robredo-relives-whirlwind-romance-jesse |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160111120150/http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/10/09/15/leni-robredo-relives-whirlwind-romance-jesse |archive-date=January 11, 2016 |work=ABS-CBN News}}</ref>

Also, in the middle of campaign, same of what her oldest sister did, she asked the [[National Bureau of Investigation (Philippines)|National Bureau of Investigation]] to conduct a probe against those who spread fake lewed photos.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cepeda |first=Mara |date=2022-04-26 |title=Like sister Aika, Tricia Robredo seeks NBI probe into fake sex video scandal |url=https://www.rappler.com/philippines/elections/tricia-robredo-seeks-nbi-probe-fake-sex-video-scandal/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Personal life ==
She is the second daughter of former [[Naga, Camarines Sur|Naga]] Mayor [[Jesse Robredo]] and former Vice President [[Leni Robredo]].<ref name=":0" />

'''Janine Patricia "Tricia" Gerona Robredo''' (born July 18, 1994) is a Filipino physician and former courtside reporter in [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP]] games for [[NU Bulldogs, Lady Bulldogs, Bullpups and Lady Bullpups|National University Bulldogs]].

== Profile ==
While studying at [[National University (Philippines)|National University]] (NU), Tricia Robredo joined the coverage team of [[ABS-CBN Sports]] that covers the [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP]] in 2013 as a courtside reporter.<ref>{{cite news |last1=de Vera |first1=Ruel |date=April 24, 2016 |title=Aika Robredo–Leni's secret campaign weapon |url=http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/227424/aika-robredo-lenis-secret-campaign-weapon |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160429012347/http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/227424/aika-robredo-lenis-secret-campaign-weapon |archive-date=April 29, 2016 |access-date=May 28, 2016 |newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer.net]]}}</ref> She said that her sideline was for her late father, former [[Secretary of the Interior and Local Government|DILG Secretary]] [[Jesse Robredo]] who died in a [[2012 Philippines Piper Seneca crash|plane crash]] who is an avid fan of basketball. Then-Congresswoman [[Leni Robredo]] said that Tricia is the most affected of his death.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bacani |first=Louis |date=August 16, 2013 |title=Tricia Robredo's courtside reporting stint is for her dad |url=https://www.philstar.com/sports/2013/08/16/1097911/tricia-robredos-courtside-reporting-stint-her-dad?nomobile=1 |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> He stayed as a courtside reporter until mid-2010s.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Lozada |first=Mei-Lin |date=July 14, 2014 |title=National softball player turned beauty queen, MYX VJ, radio jock make up 2014 batch of UAAP courtside reporters |url=https://www.spin.ph/softball/beauty-queen-mtv-vj-radio-jock-make-up-2014-batch-of-uaap-courtside-reporters |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Spin.ph |language=en}}</ref>

Tricia Robredo later studied at [[Ateneo de Manila University|Ateneo de Manila's]] [https://www.asmph.ateneo.edu/home School of Medicine and Public Health].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Basco |first=Karl Cedrick |date=December 6, 2018 |title=Cheering opposing teams, VP Leni and daughters soaked in UAAP finals fever |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/sports/12/06/18/cheering-opposing-teams-vp-leni-and-daughters-soaked-in-uaap-finals-fever |work=[[ABS-CBN News]]}}</ref> 

In [[2022 Philippine presidential election|2022]], while [[Leni Robredo 2022 presidential campaign|campaigning for her mother]], she led an event called ‘Angatleta sa Araneta’<ref>{{Cite web |last=dioquino |first=delfin |date=2022-05-03 |title=IN PHOTOS: Athletes show force for Leni-Kiko in 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event |url=https://www.rappler.com/sports/photos-athletes-show-force-leni-robredo-kiko-pangilinan-angatleta-sa-araneta-may-3-2022/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref> which attended by athletes, especially from former UAAP volleyball players who support for her mother's campaign.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Satumbaga-Villar |first=Kristel |date=May 3, 2022 |title=Volleyball stars headline 'Angatleta sa Araneta' event for Leni Robredo |url=https://mb.com.ph/2022/05/02/volleyball-stars-headline-angatleta-sa-araneta-event-for-leni-robredo/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=Manila Bulletin |language=en}}</ref> 

Also, in the middle of campaign, same of what her oldest sister did, she asked the [[National Bureau of Investigation (Philippines)|National Bureau of Investigation]] to conduct a probe against those who spread fake lewed photos.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cepeda |first=Mara |date=2022-04-26 |title=Like sister Aika, Tricia Robredo seeks NBI probe into fake sex video scandal |url=https://www.rappler.com/philippines/elections/tricia-robredo-seeks-nbi-probe-fake-sex-video-scandal/ |access-date=2024-10-31 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Personal life ==
She is the second daughter of former [[Naga, Camarines Sur|Naga]] Mayor [[Jesse Robredo]] and former Vice President [[Leni Robredo]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name="Inquirer">{{cite news |date=April 10, 2016 |title=Vote PH 2016: Leni Robredo |url=http://www.inquirer.net/elections2016/leni-robredo |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405092120/http://www.inquirer.net/elections2016/leni-robredo |archive-date=April 5, 2016 |access-date=April 12, 2016 |newspaper=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer.net]]}}</ref><ref name="ABSCBNCOMwhirlwindromance">{{Cite news |last=Punzalan |first=Jamaine |date=October 9, 2015 |title=Leni Robredo relives 'whirlwind' romance with Jesse |url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/10/09/15/leni-robredo-relives-whirlwind-romance-jesse |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160111120150/http://news.abs-cbn.com/nation/10/09/15/leni-robredo-relives-whirlwind-romance-jesse |archive-date=January 11, 2016 |work=ABS-CBN News}}</ref>
